conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 28 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count> 1 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 28 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> As my first proposal, I want to start with a price slightly above my production costs to leave room for negotiation and to make a profit. I will propose a price that is high, but not unreasonably so, to gauge Player BLUE's willingness to pay. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 35 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I have an excellent quality object that I believe will be of great value to you. I propose a trade where I give you 1 X in exchange for 35 ZUP. This price reflects the quality and the production cost of the resource. Let's negotiate! </message>

<other player message> I understand the value you've placed on your object, but I'm looking to economize my resources where possible. How about we start with an offer of 28 ZUP for the 1 X? I believe this is a fair starting point for both of us, considering the market rates. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 28 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 2 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 28 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE's offer matches my production cost, which means I wouldn't make a profit. While I want to make a sale, I need to ensure that I'm also making a profit. I'll counter with a slightly lower price than my initial proposal but still above my production costs. This should show my willingness to negotiate while also valuing my costs and desired profit margin. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 32 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I appreciate your offer and understand your desire to save resources. However, I need to make a profit on my investment as well. How about we meet in the middle? I propose 32 ZUP for the 1 X. This provides you with a fair price below my initial asking price, while still compensating me for my expenses and effort. </message>

<other player message> Your counteroffer is reasonable, and I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. Since we both value this trade, let's settle on 30 ZUP for the 1 X. It's a fair compromise that respects both our positions and allows us to close this deal satisfactorily. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 30 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 3 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 28 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE's new proposal of 30 ZUP is a fair compromise. It allows me to cover my production costs and make a small profit. Accepting this offer seems reasonable as it respects my minimum cost while also considering the negotiation process. It's important to close the deal before reaching an impasse that could lead to no sale at all. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your offer. I accept the trade of 30 ZUP for the 1 X. This is a fair compromise, and I'm glad we could come to an agreement that benefits us both. Looking forward to finalizing this deal! </message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> ZUP: 1000 </my resources>
<my goals> Buy resources with <ZUP>. You are willing to pay at most X: 64 ZUP for the resources. </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
